We want to put the smallest digit in the greatest place value. 

Which digit is the smallest?

$\maroonD1$ is the smallest digit, and we want to put it in the position with the highest place value.   

  So $\maroonD1$ will be in the thousands place: 
 $\maroonD{1}{,}$ $\_$ $\_$ $\_$

Now we need to do the same thing with the next smallest digit:  $\blueD1$.  

  So  $\blueD1$ goes in the hundreds place:  

$\maroonD{1}{,}\blueD1$ $\_$ $\_$

The next smallest digit is the $\purpleC2$.  The $\purpleC2$ goes in the place to the right of hundreds--the tens place:  

$\maroonD{1}{,}\blueD1\purpleC2$  $\_$

The greatest digit is the $\greenD7$.  The  $\greenD7$ goes in the ones place:  

$\maroonD{1}{,}\blueD1\purpleC2\greenD7$ 

The smallest possible number we can make is $\maroonD{1}{,}\blueD1\purpleC2\greenD7$.
